column4: Mega-thanx... that link is outta' hand. You are truely The Guru!
Nah, I love Grsync; just wasn't aware of all that can be modified....It's what I love about *nix but, more importantly it's users shareing their infinate knowlege...
They must be all getting coffee. :-)
no need if his router does the connections and runs an own dns-server (as it apparently does)
That makes sense but I've always used those givin by my ISP.
Then again my ISP supplies the router.
will slow down dns-request if being behind a router with dns-proxy
Ans I believe it was already configured.
it should be :) several ways to achieve a connection
every ext-fs has an own "lost+found"
Thanks, I knew a CLI approach would be better; unfortunately, I'm CLI challenged.. :-(
Now, you've totally confused me. Not that that's that hard to do, these days..
Now, you try to place three of the same words, in a row and have it, them be grammatically correct.
Thanx.
I beg your pardon.?
No prob. :D
'Twas ot; thought you might get a chuckle; if I was wrong, my humblest apologies; it'll NEVER happen again, trust me.
whatever, i just don't read any unannounced pm
NP.
Not really what I wanted to hear; but many thanks anyway..
Thought it was an ext. drive..
Aster I guess I wasn't following closely enough. Very, very sorry. A thousand pardons.
When you get a second, and just out of curiosity, what did I miss?
